page.title: 08A Laceby survey
page.content: A small survey of Laceby has shown that most people came to live here because they liked living in the countryside and they liked living here.Most people used the library but half said they used it only occasionally.All the people used the local shops and most thought that they where conveniently situated and that the prices compared very favourably with town shops.People though there was a need for a hardware shop and a chemist shop.They were satisfied with the local schools and said there children were happy at school.They used and supported the amenities found in the village but with most families having their own transport the public transport was only used by about half of our survey.The state of repair of footpaths and roads was a cause of concern.
